Description: Given raw participant-level data, all necessary data.frame transformations are made to create input data for all workflows
Given raw participant-level data, a properly specified Workflow for a KRI creates summarized and flagged data
Given raw participant-level data with missingness, a properly specified Workflow for a KRI creates summarized and flagged data
Given pre-processed input data, a properly specified Workflow for a KRI creates summarized and flagged data
Given appropriate metadata (i.e. vThresholds), flagged observations are properly marked in summary data
Given appropriate metadata (i.e. vThresholds), data.frame of bounds can be created
Given appropriate raw participant-level data, flag values can be correctly assigned to records that meet flagging criteria, including custom thresholding.
Given appropriate raw participant-level data, flag values are correctly assigned as NA for sites with low enrollment.
Given appropriate raw participant-level data, an Adverse Event Assessment can be done using the Normal Approximation method.
Adverse Event Assessments can be done correctly using a grouping variable, such as Site or Country for KRIs, and Study for QTLs, when applicable.
Given appropriate raw participant-level data, a Protocol Deviation Assessment can be done using the Normal Approximation method.
Protocol Deviation Assessments can be done correctly using a grouping variable, such as Site or Country for KRIs, and Study for QTLs, when applicable.
Given appropriate raw participant-level data, a Dispositon Assessment can be done using the Normal Approximation method.
Disposition Assessments can be done correctly using a grouping variable, such as Site or Country for KRIs, and Study for QTLs, when applicable.
Given appropriate raw participant-level data, a Labs Assessment can be done using the Normal Approximation method.
Labs Assessments can be done correctly using a grouping variable, such as Site or Country for KRIs, and Study for QTLs, when applicable.
Given appropriate raw participant-level data, a Data Change Rate Assessment can be done using the Normal Approximation method.
Data Change Rate Assessments can be done correctly using a grouping variable, such as Site, Country, or Study, when applicable.
Given appropriate raw participant-level data, a Data Entry Lag Assessment can be done using the Normal Approximation method.
Data Entry Lag Assessments can be done correctly using a grouping variable, such as Site, Country, or Study, when applicable.
Given appropriate raw participant-level data, a Query Age Assessment can be done using the Normal Approximation method.
Query Age Assessments can be done correctly using a grouping variable, such as Site, Country, or Study, when applicable.
Given appropriate raw participant-level data, a Query Rate Assessment can be done using the Normal Approximation method.
Query Rate Assessments can be done correctly using a grouping variable, such as Site, Country, or Study, when applicable.
